description:
Spicy Garden is my go to for inexpensive Chinese food (inexpensive compared to Fang, MY China, but a little bit more expensive than Panda Express). I find that the fried battered dishes are generally a miss for me. Anything fried is heavily, heavily breaded, and the batter is much too thick to be enjoyable (i.e. honey walnut prawns - which at $14 is not cheap at all of a dish). However, if you order something stir fried, Spicy Garden does a pretty good job. The menu can be a bit overwhelming because there are so many items, but a favorite of mine is the scallion lamb - very tender, few tendon in the pieces, and very flavorful. 

Be careful around the area of Mission and 6th though! This has been widely regarded as the most dangerous street corner in San Francisco so if you can help it, avoid walking up to Market on 6th after you've received your take out order.

Also, Spicy Garden does offer free delivery over a certain minimum, so take advantage of that while it lasts!
author: Austin W.

description:
This place is . I think that's nicest tagline I can possibly write. The irritable grinch of a man behind the counter lacked any sort of amicable social skills and presented as if telling him 'I always walk by but I'm excited to finally stop in!' was a nuisance! of all things! But you don't eat exceptionally poor customer service so moving on. 

The food was awful.  ! I'm pretty certain it's no accident or isolated incident my food was bad. I got sesame chicken. 

Or at least that mushy abomination they're overcharging for and calling sesame chicken. The breading was too thick and overcooked making it more reminiscent of a dog regurgitation of canned chicken being battered and served to you. 

I could go on but both the service and food are terrible. You have no one to blame but yourself for an awful experience after choosing to go there having reading this.

**EDIT: I realize that saying I always walk by isn't the greatest thing for a store owner to hear. An apt one would realize it's no insult. They might also inquire as to what made me stop in. Or utilize the opportunity make the assertion and set the expectation that my experience would be great and I'd return as a result.
author: Bakari T.

description:
This is not an authentic Sichuanese restaurant.  As well, I'd venture to say the food quality is below that of the places in the Metreon cafeteria.  

When I went, I ordered dan dan noodles, twice cooked pork, eggplant with garlic sauce, and string beans.  Nothing tasted as it should.  The noodles were not spicy and peppery with the numbing sensation and tasted overly like peanuts.  The twice cooked pork was overcooked and covered in those small black beans, pretty much always a bad sign.  The eggplant in garlic sauce was too sweet and tasted suspiciously like ketchup.  The string beans were edible I guess...  Nevertheless, a disaster overall.  

If you're looking for a Sichuanese restaurant in/around SOMA, keep looking.
author: Simon G.

description:
Got the cumin lamb and pickled mustard fish filet soup-- gotta find some comfort foods when you're under the weather.

The lamb was a little light on portion for Chinese spots, but hey, lamb isn't the cheapest around these parts. While it certainly wasn't too dry, more moisture would have been appreciated. This was a little bit jerky-like in some parts. Good cumin flavor (especially if it's coming through while my sinuses are clogged!). 3.45/5. 

The pickled mustard noodle soup (yeah I didn't know it came with noodles either-- the thick glass kind) was perfect for someone sick. The fish was a bit mushy on the outside, but I think that's sort of expected when you freeze and unfreeze fish (sole, I think). Definitely felt like home cooking, if my mom was from Szechuan haha. I with the fish / tofu to noodle ratio were a bit better though. It felt really healthy / not oily so that's a definite plus, especially given all the super oily Chinese food around these parts. 3.45/5.

While I didn't love the place, I'd definitely be back for more items on a day I'm craving home cooked sort of foods!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Ahhh so awful. Just got take out and everything arrived mushy. The breading around the chicken was soggy, there was no way that was cooked fresh. It looked like it was microwaved from a few days ago. We even pre-ordered before they opened for dinner hoping that we would have a fresh batch but nope!
It's just unfortunate to have to throw out that much food.
author: Maryrose D.

description:
The food was delicious. Was here for a team luncheon. Ordered 4 different dishes and 3 of them were yummy.

F12 Spicy Beef with Rice Lunch - 5
F27 Curry Lamb Over Rice Lunch - 4
F14 Scallion Lamb Slices Over Rice Lunch - 4
L9 Tantan Noodle - 2.5 
(more on the sweeter side with sweet peanut sauce, people who like their noodles sweet might like it).

The spicy beef hoOverall it was a good experience.
author: Keerthi C.

description: This place is good quick and pretty cheap. Close to 6th and mission in a rough area. If u can handle that it is a little gem. Lunch specials are really good.
author: David C.

description:
As part of the day's Meal Pal, my friends and I came here for lunch. We got a Shredded Spicy Pork with Garlic and it came with a side of hot and sour soup. They got the food out to us rather quickly, which is a plus, and the food as a whole was relatively flavorful.

The drawback is that you're mostly just eating a giant pile of rice, and while the food items were flavorful, they weren't exactly the best quality. The pork was mostly just bamboo shoots and other vegetables, and all of the taste came from the sauce. So in essence I was eating rice with "sauce" as that was the only thing you could really taste from the whole meal.

While I would be fine eating here again, I just don't find the food itself to be particularly all that good (although it is filling). Hopefully will be able to pass for other meal options in the future.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Loved the cucumber egg soup. Very simple and tasty. Subtle and not too much of anything. I ordered the General Tzao chicken and it was crispy, comfortably spicy and delicious. 
The owner has an interesting, understated sense of humor and takes the time to explain things. Mist enjoyable eating experience of my San Francisco weekend.
author: Albert V.

description:
Realistically, if you've come to Spicy Garden, you're probably not looking for a high end dining experience. Even then, I have to say I was fairly disappointed by what I got. 

I ordered the sweet and sour noodle soup and while the taste was good, I literally just got broth with noodles. In most sweet and sour soups, there's a bit of tofu and other ingredients but this place was just pure broth. It felt really misleading. Furthermore, the food took quite a while to come out even though it wasn't that busy. I can see myself possibly coming back to try something else on the menu but don't get what I got. Definitely not worth.
author: Cassie Z.

description: Home style Sichuan cooking most of their business through catering bomchoy was little seeet they probably added some sugar; mapo tofu was authentic tic w salty from Sichuan broad bean paste and black bean
author: Doug C.

description:
Food is solid and the flavors are all there. I would definitely NOT recommend this place for a dine-in experience. Doesn't really give you a good feeling walking in but I can attest the food -- at least the house combination numbing spice pot was very tasty and authentic. I've had better in the Richmond but this place was nearby and SoMa has a dearth of good Szechuan.

Very quick service. Great for takeout/delivery but wouldn't recommend this as a dining establishment sort of place. 

2 stars for environment. 4 stars for food.
author: Cindy W.

description: I have my food deliver on time however there are dead bugs in my food and it looks so disgusting I can't continue the food I ordered and I consider healthy problem of this restaurant. This is a waste of my time and money, I will not go back to this restaurant again.
author: Jane J.

description: The house fried rice was okay, but more of what you would expect in cities with smaller Asian populations, and definitely not good for SF. Heavy on the soy sauce and clumpy, with large, weirdly-textured pieces of chicken and pork.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Delicious and authentic Szechuan food. The hot and sour soup was great, loved our combination hot pot, and the cucumbers with woodear mushrooms. Will be back to try more items on the menu. I'd bet if this restaurant was in a different part of town it'd be hard to get a seat. 

Owner was very friendly and suggested the soup as well as other items to try next time. I'll happily look past the neighborhood and the worn interior for a tasty and affordable meal.
author: Shieva R.

description: The dumpling pot was one of the most flavorful dishes I've ever had. Delicious. They bring it out with the pot still being heated by a burner underneath. That boiled down the broth a bit.
author: Matt S.

description: Poor quality of food.  Portions are large a but taste horrible.  I've used them with mealpal and it's has been nothing but disappointment. Avoid this place.
author: K F.

description: Good prices / mediocre food. The 1st thing I had (spicy beans & rice) was soso. At $7.90 or $9.50 with tax & tip, you can eat here everyday. Plus with the down scale neighborhood & homeless people, this place is a bit of an oasis. Will try it again next time if I'm in the neighborhood a lunch time.
author: Leung T.

description: This is a tiny place,  full of amazing flavor!  We ordered the spicy beef tendon and the spicy fish fillet with flaming chili oil.    I have never had dishes that were cooked to such perfection!  The fish was fabulous, not too spicy to eat just perfect. Cooked just right!  The beef tendon is a cold salad with cucumber and chili, unbelievably good!
author: Alisa F.

description: We ordered delivery and the food never came for two hours and so tried to cancel the food. When we called the restaurant we got no apology but only attitude. They never refunded us the money and we never got the food.
author: Kyongah L.

description: This place is located in a hood, and look somewhat shady, BUT the food is legit! So far the best Sichuan food/Spicy food I can find in SF. Love their hot oil fish dish and sautee string beans, the flavor is just amazing!
author: Lien-Jung C.

description:
Still good meal. Authentic Chinese options if you read the menu. Plus the usual Americanized Chinese. Ordered:
Sweet & Sour Pork - 5
Fried fish- 5
Tofu w/beef - 5
author: Charles K.

description: Been here couple times. The food is ok. The service is ok. It's kind of place grub and go. Lunch deal is nice
author: Clancy Y.

description: Environment isn't fancy, but I'm not here for the ambiance, I'm here for the food; and boy, did they deliver on that account. Chicken hot pot with Sichuan pepper was on-point and the portion was just right. Definitely returning next time I'm in town.
author: Stetson B.

description:
A friend recommended Spicy Garden a while ago and I finally tried it out a few weeks ago. The restaurant is in an unassuming spot in SOMA, which makes it an interesting place to dine in or order takeout from. They actually have free delivery if you call in your order - so there's no need to pay the UberEats or Caviar fee! 

Their Szechuan dishes are authentic - spicy and flavorful - and I'd recommend the Spicy Fish Fillet with Flaming Chili Oil, Twice Cooked Pork and Beef in Hot and Numbing Spicy Pot if you want authentic Szechuan food. Their other dishes are good too, especially their tofu and veggie options.
author: Ada C.

description: Good food and great prices. Definitely needs to be maintained better and needs nicer decoration to make it feel pleasing to the eyes.
author: J M.

description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant while staying at a SF hotel. The delivery was made in decent time and I enjoyed the food. I ordered spring rolls, green onion pancakes, chicken fried rice and vegetable & dumpling soup. The spring rolls were good, the cabbage pieces inside were plentiful but chopped a bit large for my taste (they would pull out of the roll when you took a bite). But the flavors were good so that wasn't a big deal. The green onion pancake was ok if a bit greasy. The fried rice was very good, I liked the flavors they came up with for it. They didn't have my favorite wonton soup but they had something called vegetable and dumpling soup which was pretty good. There was a lot of bok choy in a chicken broth, and the dumplings were decent. They didn't seem hand made but they were still good. All in all I was pleased with my order and I would order from them again.
author: David N.

description: it is a hard working very friendly authentic chinese sit down/take out place. nothing fancy, . I got the spicy beef noodle soup and a free tea. big soup dish, but the spot, not hangry anymore. priced for SF less than 9.99. check the menu. liked it.
author: Klaus B.

description: Had the Kung pao tofu. Great prices. Just walked in after looking for a spot while I was traveling thru San Fran. Lunch specials looked great. Decent vegetarian/vegan options!  very flavorful and friendly service
author: V V.

description:
This is one of my favorite places for lunch in the city. I find myself coming back again and again. It's not a fancy dine in experience, but the food is authentic, service is fast, and you get value for money. 

It's the only place I know of where you can get 水煮鱼 (Spicy Fish in Chili Oil) as a lunch special . Make sure to try their amazing 夫妻肺片 (couples delight) as well.
author: Han C.

description:
Quite authentic Sichuan food for the area. Key is to order from the "folk cuisines" section, the "hot & numb spicy pot" section or some Sichuan classics like couple's delight. They have the same Americanized Chinese food menu choices found in every Chinese restaurant (e.g. beef broccoli or sweet and sour whateves) but I would say avoid those. If you look at the reviews, seems people who disliked the food seemed to all have ordered from the Americanized Chinese food section. 

The area (6th street) is very sketchy (even though it is very close to Powell street), so nothing in the neighborhood seems nice. Like the area, this place seems run down. 

But according to yelp they have 86/100 clean score. I have seen fancy restaurants that scored lower than that.
author: Xing W.

description:
Was craving some Sichuan flavors so came onto Yelp and decided to order takeout from here.  Fast and friendly service but was disappointed with the food.

Ordered fried rice, lime chicken, ma po tofu and spicy beef tendon.  The lime chicken was not what we were expecting; it was very breaded and was essentially sweet and sour like chicken.  The ma po tofu was a bit disappointing as there was no ground pork or chili peppers to be found (and overall had zero spice level).  The spicy beef tendon was good but again also not spicy!

Unfortunately not what we were hoping for at all; likely will try other spots before coming back.
author: Siv L.

description:
I hunt for well-made mapotofu (essentially a spicy tofu Sichuan dish) in every city that I visit, and Spicy Garden was the winner in San Francisco. It was located just a block from the apartment that I was living in; it was cheap; and delivery was fast! Most days, though, I just stopped by after work and ordered two orders of mapotofu.

The tofu itself comes in a huge plastic container, with rice in takeout boxes. Most mapotofu dishes (in both American chain restaurants and Chinese restaurants) are made incorrectly; there is a specific Sichuan peppercorn that needs to be used to create the correct balance of spicy yet satisfying. The sauce should not feel meaty or thick like stock; it should be smooth and silky. The tofu should be soft. And when blended with rice, it should not clump together.

Spicy Garden's mapotofu met all the criteria. The best part? It's CHEAP. A huge container of mapotofu was only $7.95 and could last me for 3 meals.

Most of their other dishes are too oily or salty, though, so 1 star off for that. I never get anything but the mapotofu so it doesn't bother me haha. The decor and interior is absolutely horrible too. White walls, white tile, uncomfortable tables. I get that it's supposed to be primarily takeout, but I shouldn't feel like I'm sitting in a basement in a seedy Harlem joint...
author: Vivian L.

description:
For me, this is the quintessential take-out restaurant. While there are dine-in options and rarely some folks doing just that, it is really not much to look at inside. 

We only ever get the traditional Szechuan dish, spicy boiled fish, or 'shui zhu yu'. It is not the best we've ever had, but it is up there. Nicely spiced, a little disappointing on the 'numbing' from the sichuan peppercorns - actually not sure it's made with any - but made up for in taste, quality of the fish, and a good portion size.
author: David J.

description: We ordered some food for delivery. It was edible, but far from great. The egg flower soup was more of a fried egg soup. It was like they had a chicken base and dropped a large chuck of scrambled eggs in it. Not quite a flower of egg. The sweet & sour pork was bland, and was made up of a lot of gristle and fat. We were not impressed with it and will be adding this to our "don't order from here" list.
author: Joseph J.

description: Good place for lunch break. Food quality is ok compare to price. Plus accept credit card.
author: Hana H.

description:
Almost 2 hour wait for delivery! I am hangry.

OMG. Total non-Asian. Bland!!!

Green-beans with sated egg yolk - soggy. 
Chow mein - needs more flavors. 
Crispy fish with peppers - outside is spicy but fish itself needs seasoning. 
Beef with broccoli - meh
Shrimp with walnuts - mushy
Beef with broccoli - too sweet. 

Will not spend this much money again on this place. Horrible. Can't believe this place has four stars. Misleading.
author: Jo D.

description:
A hole in the wall Chinese food that is the BOMB.COM! Okay. Count me in!

 I came here as I was in San Francisco and I was in the Mission area. After glancing at the menu that is displayed outside. I noticed that there prices were really reasonable...I just couldn't pass it up.

As I walked in, I was greeted right away by the workers. There was seating available right away so I didn't have to wait. 

They start you off with some tasty Cucumbers....OMG! whatever vinegar seasoning they put on it is BOMB! I was asking the workers for the secret and they was holding out on me! They responded, "No secret just cucumbers". But NA, NA, NA I'm telling you, they put something on them.

They have yummy appetizers and a lunch menu! For the portions they provide the prices are amazing!

Once we ordered we also got a hot and spicy soup! It was good...but nothing to brag about.

What I ordered:
~Lamb and Rice (rated: 3/5)
~Kung Pho Chicken and Rice (rated:5/5)
~Steamed chicken with sweet and spicy sauce (rated:5/5) ** A must try**

EVERYTHING was so good and the portions were huge...(enough for 2 people guaranteed).

From the outside the restaurant doesn't look appealing but once you walk in you can definitely smell the good food cooking.

With plenty of seats and great workers! I am definitely recommending this restaurant.

Oh! Don't worry Spicy Garden, I will definitely be back to try more of that good food on the menu!
author: Porsche C.

description:
Another Chinese place trying to take some of Allstar and Magic Wok business away. Their foods are all comparable. Low quality in attempt to be cheap.

Magic Wok has the advantage of being faster due to their food already cooked and sitting on the steam table. This place is primarily sit in and off free soup.
author: M C.

description: Using the online menu was fast and easy. The selection was wonderful, and prices were great. My food arrived in approximately 1 hour, and was piping hot. The Beef and String dish  that I ordered was very good, however the sauce had a a bit of a salty taste. With that being said, I'd order it again.
author: Virginia G.

description:
Almost a 2 hour wait for delivery. Not sure if this is Eat24's fault or Spicy Garden, but we won't order from here again as a result.

It's a shame, because the food was tasty. The Beef with Broccoli was a bit too sweet, but we loved the fried fish and the lamb. Maybe we'll order again, but put in the order around 4:00 PM so it gets here in time for dinner.
author: H C.

description:
Not bad at all.  Four stars for their Spicy Beef in Hot Oil and three stars for the Three Cups Chicken.  

If you do take-out, however, make sure they pack it really well for you.  I nearly had an accident in the car because the waitress put a soupy dish on the top of the pile and it spilled all over.
author: Kristen S.

description:
We came here on a Monday night around 6pm and walked into an empty restaurant. There was no music in the background, so we chatted quietly too awkward to make much noise. Anyways, we ordered several dishes to share. 

Lamb Skewers: comes with 4 pieces, spicy, very delicious

Spicy Fish Filet w/ Flaming Chili Oil: favorite Szechwan dish! definite must, but don't let the fish sit in the oil for too long, it gets really salty 

Yangzhou Fried Rice: strange, this dish usually contains barbecue pork, but the restaurant made it with spam.   

Eggplant w/ Garlic Sauce: pass, the eggplants were slightly undercooked 

Chicken w/ Explosive Chili Pepper: pass, the chicken tasted like popcorn chicken from a boba shop

I'm pretty sure this restaurant is family owned and the cook is the mother. She was so nice to come out to ask us if the food was good and if the fish was spicy enough for us. Next time, I'll probably order take-out to avoid the awkwardly empty restaurant and the walk on 6th St.
author: Melanie H.

description:
Ordered hot and sour soup with Chicken with Explosive Chili Pepper. So bland.  The soup was tasteless, the chicken (ordered very spicy) had zero sauce and was just dry, dry, dry chicken nuggets with chopped up chili peppers.

Quite frankly, the food was disgusting; I couldn't eat it and it ended up in the garbage disposal.  

My wife I'm sure will leave feedback on her meal.  I'd sooner starve than eat here again.
author: H E.

description:
Wasn't expecting such fresh and delicious Chinese cuisine! I got the Mongolian beef and it was really good. I had that same dish at a different restarting in SF and the beef was gross. 

This beef was very tender and it was perfectly cooked. Definitely will be back!
author: Paul B.

description:
As of now...they've got my  favorite Shui Jiu Yu (the closest to authentic sichuan)

yeah People-- approach this as an exploration of traditional sichuan cuisine & NOT your typical  Chinese-American Fast Food place. I guarantee you'll have a way more dynamic experience.

Also...prices are on point (all the other sichuan spots I've tried are sensationalized & overpriced ).
author: Chapstiq G.

description: I really like the basil Chicken appetizer but I found that the food overall was not very spicy. The chicken with explosive chili pepper was not spicy at all even though it was buried in peppers. I would have liked more heat from a place with spicy in the name.
author: Max W.

description:
tldr: for authentic Szechuan food, get the meats in flaming chili oil or the dry hot pots. Big portions, super cheap, and amazingly fast delivery.

This was the first Chinese restaurant I ordered delivery from when I moved to SF last month and it was easily the best decision I made that week. I got the house special fried rice, seasonal bok choy stir-fried with garlic, beef dry hot pot, and as a nod to my Americanized palate, sweet and sour pork.

Everything was generously-portioned and the beef hot pot is so big it comes split into two containers. 
I liked everything and will definitely order delivery again.
author: Cindy T.

description: We came here because we were shopping at the nearby Westfield and were craving some chinese food. We were on vacation and didn't know the city well so I got on yelp and found this place, it had pretty good reviews so we walked over. I admit I was a little skeptical when I saw it because of its size and its "Mom & Pop" feel but the food was all DELICIOUS. We had the honey walnut shrimp (perfection) and scallion beef. Both were fresh and flavorful. I would definitely go back when I'm in the city again.
author: Nadia B.

description:
Way too salty, too oily... Did I mention too salty? I felt like I was licking a salt stone!!

I had high hopes for this place when I reviewed the menu on Yelp. I called in and placed an order for spicy beef noodle soup and a side of potstickers. Was given an estimate of 10 minutes. It was perfect since it was a 10 min walk from my work.

Arrived to see that it was a busy restaurant full of construction workers... Perhaps a questionable sign.

Got back to work to eat and on first bite realized how salty the soup was so I poured it out and try to eat the noodles and beef. Unfortunately the soup and oil had coated each and every noodle and it was still too salty. 

The potstickers were alright. Tasted like they should.
author: Tiffany L.

description: A+++ as far as takeout Chinese food goes. The flavor is on point and the selection as good as it gets for an authentic Chinese restaurant. From the outside it might not look like much, but I discovered it while on my way to an improv class at Leela's last year. And what a find! The food is quite good and the portions very generous for the price. My favorite here is the cucumber egg soup--very savory and light.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Ordered to go at 11 am this morning and it arrived at our home at noon

We had the schicun chicken, schicon fish, green onion pancake, tan tan noodles and shrimp,with walnuts

Everything was really good
author: Foodlover B.

description: A neighborhood favorite of mine. Gets my vote for the best moo shu vegetables around.
author: Alec B.

description:
Tasty szechuan food. I've only had delivery and even after taking a trip, the food holds up quite well. 
Just be warned: the delivery is probably going to take 30 minutes longer than the eat24 estimate.
author: Steve L.

description: The deep fried bitter melon with salted egg yolk is just a sliver from being perfect.
author: Jane M.

description: Great food. 跟在重庆吃到的味道很相近！it's probably the closest taste you can find in San Francisco. Ordered 毛血旺 the contents are good
author: Yumi K.

description:
I eat here once every 2 weeks or so, order pickup online since it's around the corner from my office. Never disappointed. Total "Hole in the Wall".

Pros: Great food at a super low price, large portions, very fast for takeout, and I have heard pretty decent in authenticity. Staff is friendly and courteous, and gives off that "mom and pop" feel.

Cons: Location is in a sketchy neighborhood, and you will invariably encounter street people around the store front. Decor and ambiance when dining in is not great, and I wager the food is not super healthy either, but neither of these qualms is unexpected given the price.
author: Anthony P.

description: Fast and friendly delivery service! Was pleasantly surprised at the true Szechuan flavors that came through -- especially for the spicy beef tendon, the cold jelly + black bean dish, sichuan chicken. Basically spicy food is the way to go here :) Will definitely be ordering delivery from them again!
author: wendy q.

description:
I ordered from here for pickup, I asked for everything spicy, only one thing was actually spicy.
I'm kinda used to that, but everything was very tasty.
The spicy tendon and cumin lamb were delicious, so I recommend those.
author: Tom S.

description: So much MSG! Vegetable tasted so gross. I guess they just threw anything left into the wok. The vegetable maybe have been gone bad. Worst Chinese food I've ever had!
author: Sophy X.

description:
Fantastic food!  Traditional Asian delicacies made with traditional Asian style (and just a hint of American style)- simply delicious!  Hot dishes and chilled dishes to suit any palette with traditional hot, black tea served at every table! 

Personally, I would recommend their Cucumber Salad to anyone- it is simple and absolutely de-lish!  

As with most San Francisco structures, the location is plain and slightly ugly- DON'T LET THAT DETER YOU!  These artisans prepare to order and each plate I've had there has been awesome!  Also, their prices are extremely affordable for all, and their servings are good sized!  

While it is not stated anywhere on their menu, I would say they truly aim to please!  2 Big thumbs up to The Spicy Garden!
author: Paul H.

description: This is my favorite restaurant nearby my house. I always order to go food and they have alot of options. I really love explosive shezuan chicken and salt pepper prawn. Their tastes are bomb.
author: Nita W.

description: This is the best Chinese restaurant around this neighborhood. The dishes that I like the most are couple delights and sweet & sour pork; also, the staffs are friendly and very nice!
author: Kevin W.

description:
When you big babies who complain all the time about "those people" get over yourselves, come on down to 5th and Mission, which used to be a Ramaytush village. 
It's a village of a different type now; the Village Of The Damned. However, every village has to have a place to eat. If you're brave enough to get there, you're brave enough to eat there. The Kung Pao Chicken made me sweat and cleared my sinuses, and that's good thing. You have to love a place with dishes like Pork Intestine Stir-Fried w/ Explosive Chili Peppers, Chong Qing Mao Xue Wang, and Flaming Spicy Kidney. The vegetarian dishes don't have such interesting names, but I plan to try the Shredded Potato w/ Hot Chili Pepper and Dry Sautéed String Beans. 

Friendly staff, homey atmosphere, (and safe, you wusses). And you get an adult portion, with tea, soup, and appetizer for under $10.
author: Joseph T.

description:
Wow, really good Sichuan food! Portion sizes are good, price is decent, and the flavors are spot on. If you like spicy food, I'd highly recommend trying this place.

We ordered the spicy beef noodle soup, twice cooked pork, and string beans. We requested less oil and salty as usual at all Chinese restaurants. The beef and pork were super tender and delicious to eat. String beans were fresh and crunchy. All three came out great- no complaints on my end.

Service is friendly. Will definitely come back when I'm in the area again!
author: Sophia H.

description: ordered the dinner plate hunan beef for take out. super easy take out process, went about 15 minutes later and picked it up easy. beef was super tender, good balance of meat and veggies, and came with a soup that i wasn't expecting. not expensive and decent portion size - enough eat a meal with and still have leftovers. would come back
author: Patrick H.

description:
My bf and I went here for lunch when we were in the city. It was conveniently located about two blocks from our hotel. I ordered the egg drop soup and the fried rice both were delicious. My bf got the pork w cabbage which is a lot more traditional for the region- it was good but a bit fatty and oily.

This def a hole in the wall but very tasty.
author: Michelle B.

description:
They're chicken wings are bomb!! The fried eggplant is definitely something I had never tried before, and a very different taste! They are like French fries, but only healthier. Try them sweet and sour sauce, and I don't think you will be disappointed! 

The guy who helped us was super friendly and really made sure our meal was ok.

Especially if you like spice, try this place! Even if you don't, there are plenty of options that aren't spicy, but is still delicious! (Chicken wings!!)
author: Jessie C.

description: I love Chinese food!! With that being said, I have tried so many spots  and most I will never do again. This place really hit the spot! It's a hole in the wall type of spot. It's an amazing find! Just did the basic house special chow mien and salt n pepper chix wing. I'm just going to say, "I will be back"! 3500 restaurants in a 49 square mile area of SF. I kan eat anywhere I want, literally. Quite the surprise. Don't ever ignore the hole in the wall spots!! Explore the world of food!!!!!!
author: JC M.

description:
I'll keep this short and sweet (and sour): The only reason I came here was because the lunch meeting I had scheduled at work was cancelled last minute, therefore, I had to fend for myself. I was in the mood for Chinese food and decided to give this place a shot since it was pretty close by. 

I can get much better Chinese food at the Safeway deli down the street from my house. I'll just leave it at that.
author: Kevin G.

description: more of a unique taste. Traditional spicy chinese, get the fish in flaming chili oil and spicy stir fried vegetables, both excellent. Don't get the beef noodle soup, that was quite disappointing.
author: Grapes T.

description:
This place is pretty good. I was walking by and decided to give this place a try. The customer service is on point and the food was pretty good. I had kungpoa chicken and whit rice. 

The only thing I didn't like was their hot sauce . It tasted kind of sour to me.
author: Adan R.

description:
Wow wow wow Yelp. What on earth happened here.

I ordered delivery (even though I live a block away) after running across the reviews on Yelp. I was so excited! To think, I had lived next to a mecca of delicious spicy Chinese food. I had never wanted to enter due to its relative emptiness and proximity to the porno theater, in addition to the the fecal matter and urine lining the streets that make me lose my appetite.

Maybe I just ordered the wrong items? But here's what I got.
Pork Belly with Garlic and Spice: 0/5. I had expected those lovely tender chunks of pork belly glazed with garlic and spice. YUM. What I got was a soup that was mildly spicy at best with cold, unappetizing thin and chewy pieces. None of the sauce was picked up either - it was very bland.
Kung Pao: 2/5. Whoever wrote this would be so spicy they sweated does not ever do sichuan or Indian. I specifically asked for spicy (two times - once in writing and once by checking "spicy") in the request for delivery. It was bland. 
String Beans: 3/5 - Probably the best of the dishes. Dried and pretty spicy. 

String beans alone weren't enough to sustain ourselves so my husband and I ended up heating up some Costco linglings potstickers. Those were pretty darn good actually.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Fantastic Szechuan food - order from the "Folk Cuisine" portion of the menu. Flavors are authentic and spicy, portions huge (even when take-out). Best dishes: silky tofu with fish fillet of sole, beef and pickled mustard green soup, sautéed vermicelli w minced pork, tofu w chili pepper. I prefer this place over Z&Y because of superior taste, larger portion size, cheaper prices, and fewer crowds.

I'm guessing the negative reviewers stuck to the more Americanized dishes. Since I would never order that, I can't comment.
author: B B.

description: Great authentic Szechuan food - great lunch spot. Mapotofu was great.
author: steven w.

description:
Came here for a quick lunch one day and the pictures on their front windows pretty much look like what their food looks like. Once you order we got some bowls of their hot and sour soup? Which was pretty decent. Their food looked okay, but it wasn't anything special. Tasted about the same too. Their spring rolls were decent and came in an order of 4 which was satisfying along with a main lunch plate. I got the spicy fish which came as a soup with a side of rice. It was like a spicy dish that is loaded with peppers and vinegar but doesn't really taste like anything besides "hot", so there wasn't too much to the dish. The other foods were very bright colored in the unnatural sense. My friend who ate there before said the meat didn't resemble anything of good quality, but I didn't have any meat on our table when I went. 

Wasn't impressed by the food, but they had good portions.
author: Kevin S.

description: Probably the smallest size of boiling fish I have had in US. And not authentic. Not recommend.
author: Vicky L.

description: The food  is nasty and bad service , they don't even have lemon .....never come back again
author: Jessica H.

description:
Great chinese szechuan food for great prices. The lunch specials are a great deal around 6.55-7 dollars at the time I wrote this review. My favorite lunch special is the spicy fish over rice.
I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for spicy chinese food at reasonable prices.
author: Arthur C.

description:
I'm so happy that now we have a designated Sichuan restaurant that delivers to our house in the Mission District. I used to live in Beijing, and a big fan of Sichuan food. There are better Sichuan restos in the Bay Area obviously...but for delivery, these guys are our go-to. Yummi, spicy Sichuan...yes!

What we usually order from Spicy Garden:

L9 Tan Tan Noodles - dry, delicious majiang (sesame) sauce, spicy 

G19 Hui Guo Rou- Twice cooked pork

B16  Pai Huang Gua- Cucumber salad, oh garlic lord!

D5 Ma la Xiang Guo - Spicy numbing pot. I usually order the house combo, but the assorted mushroom  is awesome too!

G18 Chong qing La zi ji - spicy fried chicken with chili pepper - yummmmmmi, no bones, but I order this every time, because I love the dish

G1 All the shui zhu (chili oil) dish are pretty decent (fish, beef, and tofu)

H10 Dry string beans- love, love, love this garlicky, crispy beans

B6 Deep Fried chicken wings - my husband's (Bostonian) favorite. He's not so familiar with Sichuan food, but he thinks this chicken wings dish is AMAZING.

I haven't tried all the dishes yet, but I will. I'll update the review soon after! I don't know how they do the regular Chinese dishes, but for Sichuan dishes they definitely know what they're doing!
author: SS s.

description: Overall, below average. If I had to use a word: bland. / business which was only 5blocks away still took 65mins to drop off food. / particularly disappointing: walnut prawns (soggy and covered in some kind of mayo sauce).
author: Sen-Sei S.

description:
Nice Szechuan food. IMO it is even better than "The Pot Sticker (麻辣一品)" in chinatown.

Some of the reviews mentioned the food is too salty or oily, but Szechuan food is known for that. On average each day a Chinese people consumes about three times of the daily intake amount of sodium recommended here. So if anyone wants to try authentic Chinese food (except southern cuisines like Hong Kong, Cantonese, and Hokkien), be prepared for that.
author: Chen P.

description: A little hole in the wall but AWSOME food! Hot and sour soup was perfect. They even added garlic to the fried rice for us. Highly recommend
author: Zachary O.

description: My go to Chinese delivery place. Order the exploding chicken, ma po tofu, string beans. Huge portions (exploding chicken is two containers), quick delivery (usually 30-45 min), and is truly spicy food. Delivery is also free. Would not rec picking up as its in a pretty sketchy h part of town.
author: Doug G.

description:
I'm a fan. Quality chow mein in SOMA is pretty limited so if you make my chow mein extra spicy as requested then you will get an extra star. Along with the chow mein I ordered the fried garlic eggplant which I really enjoyed. It was pretty much like garlic fries but made with egg plant - unique and interesting to say the least. 

Overall it's nearby and decently priced, I will definitely be back.
author: William L.

description:
Spicy Garden serves one of the best Szechuan food i've had in the beautiful city of San Francisco. Don't get me wrong, i've had really good oriental food in the BayArea, but this restaurant in particular really stands out from the others. If you haven't tried their chicken wings (Lord forgive you), you haven't lived your life to the fullest...

Dont believe me? Just Watch.. 
1) Amazing & quick service (100% guaranteed)
2) Hardworking employees (The owners are 'hella' Nice)
3) Good vibes (No bitch will kill your vibe here)
4) Trippy neighborhood (Don't worry bout it tho)
5) Delicious oriental food (The best take out for the fam) 

I honestly recommend this restaurant if your trying to get your oriental fix for your hunger. I'd give this restaurant a 10 out of 5! All day errday!
author: Ryan L.

description: Got the lunch special sweat and sour chicken over rice and ur was disgusting the chicken didn't even looked like chicken it had an odd texture and they just threw the sause over it didn't even completely mix it. And only had like 8 small pieces of chicken and small rice portion . The plate is what made it look big! Never again
author: Linda H.

description: Wow we are from out of town and got in late.   We called for delivery TO A HOTEL so assumed that would know we may not have little packets of soy sauce, spoons, plates (that I requested) on hand.  Sure enough not only is the food bland an uninventive, there is not a packet to be found.  After paying over $50 for REALLY crappy food- I would recommend Panda Express 1000% at least they offer orange sauce.  When I called to inquire I was told the delivery guy "must have forgotten".  This place blows.
author: Lisa F.

description:
Ordered hot and sour soup, which was good.  Also ordered beef with broccoli, which was not.  The beef was rubbery, the broccoli was soggy, and the sauce was way to sweet.  It was thrown away.  Also ordered chicken with explosive pepper, which was just OK - too oily for my taste, but at least edible.

However, the reason for the 1-star review was that the delivery took an hour and 50 minutes!  We ordered through eat24, which estimated 30-45 minutes, so this was totally unacceptable.  Furthermore, the driver had to call me to come downstairs instead of delivering to my door because he couldn't figure out how to knock and have the doorman open the door.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Really expensive for low quality food ! We got prawn fried rice, Nothing special at all. It's literally just rice with soy sauce and small amount of small shrimp. I wish I ate somewhere else.

Extra one star since the server is nice. Never coming back tho.
author: Mary U.

description:
A very good szechuan restaurant! Good service, nice food and very reasonable price!
Highly recommend sour spicy noodle to the spicy lover!!!
I will go again!
author: T Z.

description: quite place, nice people. food not exactly very sichuan, but very nice. They put cucumber in fire fry kidney. firs time I have had it, but it actually turned out very very nice, less salty than usual. will stop by again.
author: Blue B.

description:
1) friendly service via phone
2) speedy delivery of 20-minutes 
3) the best chicken wings and deep fried bitter melon I ever had! 
4) plenty of utensils and napkins without asking =) 
5) the most flavorful Chinese food in SF for me

I'd give it a 5-star if the price was less expensive.
author: Holls L.

description:
This place is solid, but nothing special. 

I got the House Chow Mein, and Fried Eggplant (based on yelp reviews). The food was good, the chow mein was filling, had a good amount of meat and vegetables, and just the right amount of kick! The fried eggplant was pretty good too, but I think anything deep fried would taste like that. 

Tip: Order from http://san-francisco.eat24hours.com/spicy-garden/23550 instead of venturing onto 6th st. or trying to find the menu on a website that doesn't exist. Enjoy!
author: Kevi L.

description:
I ordered the General Tso's chicken and it was probably worse than the frozen kind I once bought at Costco. Tiny bits of chicken that are heavily battered I expected, but the batter was very bitter and overpowered every other flavour in the dish. The Sauce wasn't very good either. 

One plus was that they were very quick... But that is likely why it was so disappointing. I won't be going back.
author: John S.

description:
I like the food very much. I've come here several times. Service is very fast and friendly.

Unfortunately, one of the servers wears very strong perfume that overcomes the smell of the delicious food each time they walk by.
author: D N.

description: AWESOME eggrolls. Fresh vegetables, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Absolutely delicious.
author: Liz F.

description: The outside may not look like much, but like people say, it's what's on the inside that matters. The food is great and affordable. $6 for lunch: rice, soup, and entree.
author: Eric M.

description: This place is a bit dirty, and not in the most ideal location.  But I guess it's true what they say when a health grade rating of C stands for good Chinese.  Highly would recommend the Sweet and Sour Pork and Kung Pao Chicken, probably their two best dishes.  Also for the best bang for your buck, come around lunch time.  $7-8 lunch specials for a modest size will probably be the best deal in town!
author: Jason C.

description: At first when we walked in it was sooo quiet and awkward and I felt hesitant. The staff was really nice. I ordered the pot stickers and they were great. Then I got chicken and broccoli and it was so gross. The sauce was jelly-ish and the chicken was slimy and rubbery. My friend got the chow mein and it was delicious. I think it's just a place where you have to order the right thing.
author: Emily L.

description: Their double cooked pork is made with laoganma chili sauce (I guess) and cabbage instead of douban paste and garlic sprouts. Maoxuewang (literarily translates to "fur-blood-prosper"?) has fish and beef inside. But this place is still GREAT! Very good Sichuan food, authentic Chinese taste.
author: Chenguang W.

description: Met all my expectations for Sichuan food. I was craving pumpkin with salted egg yolk, but their green bean with salted egg yolk fit the bill. Their food has surprisingly large portions. For the soft tofu with spicy sauce, they gave me a whole tub of tofu. I ordered via eat24, and delivery literally took 20 minutes. Win win on a sunday evening.
author: K C.

description:
The pork belly was amazing!  It's not as spicy as it looks and it comes cold as an appetizer, but the portion was so large that I could see it be a meal of its own with a side of rice.  I also got:
- eggplant (good)
- spicy numbling beef pot (huge portion and seriously hot)
- chicken wings (okay - not my favorite)
- hot and sour soup (good)
- 3-cup chicken (awesome)

Overall the price, portion, and selection was really good.  And they also deliver so extra bonus there.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Killer authentic Szechuan. Try: Fried tofu, wonton soup, hot and sour soup, cumin lamb, combo fried rice.
I wish they served beer!
This place isn't much for ambiance, but the service is good, everything is clean, and on a Monday evening, you'll have some pretty sweet fluorescent privacy.
It's also across the street from my favorite club Monarch.
author: Adam F.

description: Ordered thru Eat 24.  In a City with such a large Asian populations it is amazing just how truly awful the food was. Overpriced, flavorless, and my housemate has the runs today.  With so much awesome Chinese food in SF, really you can do better.  Or just get a hotdog from 7-11
author: EC N.

description: Ugh. The Mongolian beef was a colorless beige, rubbery, overcooked, and bland. The sesame chicken was almost entirely breading, with trace amounts of chicken. It was impossible to tell if the "crispy chicken nuggets with basil" were actually chicken or fish. The potstickers were passable, but didn't in any way redeem this terrible meal.
author: Christian W.

description: Best Szechuan food in the area (if not in the whole bay area). I stumbled upon Spicy Garden while I was roaming the streets of sf after Pride for some quick, cheap food. I did not expect to fall in love with their food, but I did. Service was not exceptional but the food made up for it almost completely. MUST TRY: fried chicken (WTF!!), hot n' sour soup, fried eggplant, spicy green beans (OMG!!), and spicy shrimp fried rice! Yes, I may have over-indulged my first time there, but I couldn't resist after trying their chicken wings! Im coming back tomorrow. Forsure!
author: Dylan W.

description: The spicy food is very good!  I'm not a spicy fan, but I really like the spicy beef and fish with chili oil. And the steamed chicken wing with spicy and sour sauce taste good. I definitely will come again!
author: Kim H.

description:
Oredered tonight because it was close by and they delivered.

Greasy and over-fried Sweet and Sour Chicken....   I think it had been sitting in the steam table for a few hours....

The soup had nasty won ton....  (Way too chewy..........)

The fried rice was bland with no meat or shrimp.......

Not worth the wait (45 minutes) Or the money (and it was cheap)
author: Louis B.

description: Yummy! Really recommend their Deep Fried Chicken Wings and Potstickers :))) Good eating experience !!!
author: Evan G.

description:
The BEST spicy food in SF!!!! I would highly recommend the FRIED CHICKEN WINGS, DEEP FRIED EGGPLANT, and the SPICY BEEF!!! Especially the FRIED CHICKEND WINGS, thats the one you must TRY!!!!! ONCE you try, im sure you will come visit more!!  And they have very NICE SERVICE too!!!  

IF you like spicy food, come try it out!!! AND im sure you will not be feeling regret or disappointed.:)
author: Steven Z.

description:
read the reviews here and ordered from them... asked for wo wanton as recommeneded and they had only pork wanton.   soup excellent, wanton were lacking in flavor
order potstickers as recommened and they indeed were good.
had fried rice combo and it had a few peas and two shrimp.. no pork or chicken and was very greasy
sweet and sour chicken was all breading and almost no chicken.

in summary a reasonable meal that went into the garbage disposal unit
oh yes, two of the plastic tops on the hot dishes were broken and contents leaked into double bagged plastic.. 
in summary, not worth the time nor the effort.
author: ira l.

description: Had lunch here today.  Their lunch specials are super good deal!  I think it was $6.95.  It came with rice and soup.  Ordered their Sichuan fish stew, one of my favorite Sichuan dishes.  Delicious!  It's oily but it's how it's supposed to be.  Will definitely come back and try other stuff!
author: Lori C.

description: Finally! We recently moved to San Francisco and have been really disappointed with the dated, Americanised chinese food most places serve here. This place is different and delicious! The szechuan food is great - best ma po tofu in SF and their assorted mushrooms in hot and numbing spicy pot is great. Also recommend their shredded potato with hot chili pepper. The restaurant is basic, but the food and the value are great.
author: Ari W.
